items.label: How to Contribute to Open Source
How to Set Up Your Project
The Power of Metrics and Analytics

becoming-a-maintainer/additional-resourc.title: Additional Resources
becoming-a-maintainer/additional-resourc.description: On this page, you will find additional resources to help you learn more about all things around open source maintainers.

becoming-a-maintainer/building-community.title: Building and Nurturing a Welcoming and Supportive Community
becoming-a-maintainer/building-community.description: Open source is more than just maintaining and improving a project. It's a dynamic environment where maintainers, contributors, and users come together to collaborate, contribute, and grow. That said, the people involved in the project are the core and heart of open source.

becoming-a-maintainer/communication-and-.title: How to Communicate and Collaborate Effectively
becoming-a-maintainer/communication-and-.description: Effective communication and collaboration with contributors are the keys to a thriving open source community. As maintainers, you want to smoothly onboard new contributors to your projects and build a welcoming community with open lines of communication between contributors and maintainers.

becoming-a-maintainer/community-translat.title: Community Course Translations
becoming-a-maintainer/community-translat.description: We are grateful for the contributions of the community in translating our courses. Although the OpenSauced team does not currently maintain these projects, we want to share the forked copy of the repositories with those taking the course. Below, you will find the latest community translations.

becoming-a-maintainer/getting-practical.title: Let's Get Practical: Starting Your Project
becoming-a-maintainer/getting-practical.description: Now that you've gone through the course and understand what it takes to be a successful maintainer, let's get practical and start your first open source project as a maintainer!

becoming-a-maintainer/how-to-setup-your-.title: How to Setup Your Open Source Project
becoming-a-maintainer/how-to-setup-your-.description: There are many things to consider when you think about how to start an open source project. In this portion of the course, we will walk through the key components every project needs to succeed.

becoming-a-maintainer/intro.title: Understanding the Role of an Open Source Maintainer
becoming-a-maintainer/intro.description: Being an open source maintainer can be a very gratifying and rewarding experience. But a lot of work goes into maintaining an open source project. You will have many responsibilities as a maintainer, including being a contributor, leader, mentor, and community manager.

becoming-a-maintainer/issues-and-pull-re.title: How to Handle Open Issues and Pull Requests
becoming-a-maintainer/issues-and-pull-re.description: One of the core responsibilities of an open source maintainer is triaging open issues and reviewing pull requests. In this chapter, we will talk about how to handle best open issues, pull requests, and security vulnerabilities.

becoming-a-maintainer/maintainer-powerup.title: Maintainer Power Ups
becoming-a-maintainer/maintainer-powerup.description: Maintainers have a variety of daily tasks. You often juggle triaging new issues, reviewing pull requests, testing changes, and managing and moderating the community, such as welcoming new contributors and thanking contributors for their contributions. Most of the time, you are expected to respond to these tasks promptly. Sometimes, these never-ending tasks take too much time and are overwhelming. It would help if you were efficient in what you do.

becoming-a-maintainer/Maintainer-README.title: Becoming a Maintainer with OpenSauced
becoming-a-maintainer/Maintainer-README.description: Welcome to the Becoming a Maintainer Course with OpenSauced! This course is designed to provide you with an introduction to how to become an open source maintainer and guide you through the process of creating your open source project, working with contributors, and more.

becoming-a-maintainer/maintainers-guestb.title: Maintainers Guestbook
becoming-a-maintainer/maintainers-guestb.description: Congratulations on finishing the Becoming a Maintainer Course with OpenSauced. Welcome to our Maintainers Guestbook, where you can share your first project with us!

becoming-a-maintainer/maintaining-code-q.title: How to Maintain Code Quality and Documentation
becoming-a-maintainer/maintaining-code-q.description: Maintaining a project with high code quality and up-to-date documentation is important. This will help contributors understand the project and make it easier for them to contribute.

becoming-a-maintainer/metrics-and-analyt.title: The Power of Open Source Metrics and Analytics for New Maintainers
becoming-a-maintainer/metrics-and-analyt.description: Understanding what's happening with your project and contributors as it grows can be challenging for new maintainers. Think of open source metrics and analytics like a compass and map in your maintainer journey. Understanding metrics for open source projects and your own project can help you to set goals, identify project needs, and understand your community. This chapter will guide you through understanding, leveraging, and making decisions based on these insights to create a thriving open source project.

becoming-a-maintainer/your-team.title: Building Your Open Source Dream Team
becoming-a-maintainer/your-team.description: Managing an open source project requires clear communication, empathy, and technical understanding. You might find that initially, you can do all or most of the work by yourself. That's great! If you want your project to grow and thrive, cultivating a diverse, motivated, and effective team around you can help you do that. This chapter looks at how to collaborate with your team effectively and offers guidance on identifying, onboarding, and empowering your open source squad.

intro-to-oss/additional-resources.title: Additional Resources
intro-to-oss/additional-resources.description: On this page, you can find resources to help you learn further about contributing to open source:

intro-to-oss/conclusion.title: Conclusion
intro-to-oss/conclusion.description: As we wrap up this course on getting started with open source, let's recap the key takeaways and discuss what's next in your open source journey.

intro-to-oss/Contributor-README.title: Intro to Open Source with OpenSauced
intro-to-oss/Contributor-README.description: Welcome to the Intro to Open Source Course with OpenSauced! This course is designed to provide you with an introduction to open source and guide you through the process of contributing to open source projects.

intro-to-oss/how-to-contribute-to-open-s.title: How to Contribute to Open Source
intro-to-oss/how-to-contribute-to-open-s.description: In this chapter, we'll guide you through the process of how to contribute to open source.

intro-to-oss/the-secret-sauce.title: The Secret Sauce
intro-to-oss/the-secret-sauce.description: In this chapter, we'll share some lesser-known strategies and tips for making a lasting impact in the open source community. We'll discuss how to focus on open issues, gain traction in your contributions, and develop your open source resume using OpenSauced.

intro-to-oss/tools-to-be-successful.title: Tools to be Successful
intro-to-oss/tools-to-be-successful.description: To be successful in your open source journey, it's essential to familiarize yourself with the tools and platforms commonly used by the community. These tools will help you collaborate effectively, manage your projects, and contribute to open source projects. In this chapter, we'll discuss the following essential tools for open source collaboration:

intro-to-oss/types-of-contributions.title: Types of Open Source Contributions
intro-to-oss/types-of-contributions.description: Contributions to open source projects can take many forms, such as coding, documentation, testing, and more. It is important to note that open source contributions are not limited to developers only. Anyone can contribute to open source projects, regardless of their technical skills.

intro-to-oss/what-is-open-source.title: What is Open Source?
intro-to-oss/what-is-open-source.description: In this chapter, we'll explore the history of open source and what that means. Before contributing to a project, you should understand what is open source and the principles behind it to help you appreciate the context in which you'll be collaborating and contributing.

intro-to-oss/why-open-source.title: Why Open Source?
intro-to-oss/why-open-source.description: In the previous chapter, we explored the concept of open source and its history. Now, let's look at the many benefits of open source software contributions. By understanding the advantages of open source collaboration, you'll be better equipped to leverage the opportunities it presents and make the most of your open source journey.
